name: .30-30 Winchester
description: At short-range, with considerably lower recoil than a .3006, the .30-30 Winchester is very popular with hunters of deer, black bear, and even moose.  Its 150gr round-nose cartridge is well suited for the tubular magazines of lever-action rifles.

name: reloaded .30-30 Winchester
description: At short-range, with considerably lower recoil than a .3006, the .30-30 Winchester is very popular with hunters of deer, black bear, and even moose.  Its 150gr round-nose cartridge is well suited for the tubular magazines of lever-action rifles.  This one has been hand-reloaded.

name: .357 Magnum
description: The high velocity and high energy .357 Magnum, with 158gr JHP in an elongated .38 Special cartridge, was developed in the 1930s.  Renown for its stopping power, the .357 is easily capable of bringing down medium to large game.

name: reloaded .357 Magnum
description: The high velocity and high energy .357 Magnum, with 125gr JHP in an elongated .38 Special cartridge, was developed in the 1930s.  Renown for its stopping power, the .357 is easily capable of bringing down medium to large game.  This one has been hand-reloaded.
